page.title: 07PLACE NAMES IN MARSDEN
page.content:
{ Peel Street-named after Sir Robert Peel a Prime Minister of Queen Victoria's reighn. Brougham road-after Lord Brougham who also lived at the time of Queen Victoria. Chain Road-this was the toll road, and was the first road between Marsden and Huddersfield.There was a chain across the road. Warehouse Hill-there was a warehouse for the canal here.You can still see the rings where the boats tied up.
Marsden-this is supposed to have been named after Marsh Dean -a wet marshy place. {Sally Carter- June 1985_
